input_text:
Job Title: Entry Level Engineer

Location: Palmer, AK

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Title: Entry-Level Civil Engineer (EIT) Company: New Horizons Telecom, Inc.
About UsNew Horizons is looking for a highly motivated qualified individual to join our team as an Entry- Level Civil Engineer (EIT). New Horizons specializes in the delivery of turnkey telecommunications infrastructure solutions for clients within all major commercial sectors and industries.  Why Join Our Team?New Horizons offers a dynamic and rewarding work environment where innovation thrives and career growth is encouraged. As an Entry-Level Civil Engineer (EIT), you’ll have the opportunity to work on exciting and unique projects that push the boundaries of telecommunications infrastructure. You will have the opportunity to team with senior engineers and industry experts on projects and gain knowledge and experience in the telecom industry. 
Job SummaryNew Horizons is seeking a highly motivated, enthusiastic individual to join our team as an Entry-Level Civil Engineer (EIT). In this role, you will play a crucial part in supporting various aspects of telecommunications projects, including permitting and engineering design. Under the guidance of experienced professionals, you will have the opportunity to learn and grow while contributing to the success of our projects. Projects typically include but are not limited to tower and shelter foundation design, equipment anchoring, platform and shelter design, site plan development, utility coordination, and fiber route design. Level of responsibility will vary depending on demonstrated experience, interests, and abilities. 
Key Responsibilities· Assist department personnel, including engineers and project managers, with a variety of assigned tasks and responsibilities. · Assist in the preparation and submission of permitting applications for telecommunications projects. · Support project managers in coordinating project activities, including scheduling, budgeting, and resource allocation. · Review and collaborate on designs and drawings with a multi-disciplinary team of engineers, subcontractors, project managers and construction managers, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations.· Maintain effective working relationships with diverse groups, including company employees at various levels, clients, vendors, government regulators and other outside companies and individuals.· Assist with and/or conduct site visits and assessments as required, providing valuable input to project teams.· Assist with development of various written documents as required by customers such as feasibility studies, structural analysis reports with supporting calculations and site visit assessment reports.· Rapid growth with knowledge and experience with project management and engineering concepts and gradually gain independence with assigned responsibilities. · Demonstrate initiation and apply organizational and problem-solving skills to identify and develop engineering and project management solutions. Minimum Requirements· NCEES Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam passing result.· Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering from an accredited university. · Demonstrate a positive attitude, reliability, and respect for colleagues and customers. · Enthusiasm for the position and a drive to learn and grow.· Ability to problem-solve and work independently as well as collaborate with the project team. · Proficiency with standard office software (MS Excel, MS Word, Teams and Outlook) is preferred. · Highly articulate and able to deliver verbal and written reports.· Must possess a valid driver’s license.· Available and able to travel for site visits (up to 15% of the time).
Benefits· Earn valuable experience under licensed professional engineers to apply towards eligibility requirements for the NCEES Professional Engineering (PE) exam. · Our flex policy allows you to design a mutually beneficial hybrid schedule· Excellent medical, dental, vision and prescription insurance benefits..· Retirement (Pension & 401K).· Competitive compensation, paid vacation & holidays.· Challenging and rewarding work environment with career development opportunities.· Part-time positions may be considered on a case-by-case basis. 
Salary· Base salary starting at $65,000.00 per year (pay is dependent on experience).
How to ApplyTo apply please email your resume to humanresources@nhtiusa.com or go to our careers page at www.nhtiusa.com/careers/ and click “Apply Now.” 
We look forward to hearing from you!
New Horizons is an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applications will be reviewed as they are received, and the position will be filled as soon as we have a satisfactory candidate pool.

Experience Level (if available): None
